;;2023-09-11T22:43:05Z;
;
;;唐纳德·特朗普于 9 月 6 日离开纽约市特朗普大厦。
;

;唐纳德·特朗普的法律团队周一要求负责监督针对他的 2020 年选举干预起诉的联邦法官将自己从该案中剔除，理由是她之前在前总统对 1 月 6 日国会大厦袭击事件负责后发表的公开评论是取消资格。

;

;向美国地区法官 Tanya Chutkan 提出的回避动议面临重大法律障碍：要成功，;特朗普;必须表明，一个“理性的人”会仅从她的言论（而不是她的任何实际裁决）得出结论，认为她无法公正地主持会议。<据两名知情人士透露，特朗普长期以来一直抱怨负责此案的法官对他有偏见，因为她之前在 1 月 6 日的其他骚乱被告案件中对特朗普的评论，他的法律团队考虑了数周提交该动议熟悉审议。

;

;;九页动议;指出了两集，其中楚特坎评论了她对特朗普煽动国会大厦袭击的责任的看法，特朗普的律师认为这导致了对前总统潜在的偏见或成见。

; <第一个例子发生在 2022 年 10 月，当时她在谈到 1 月 6 日时说道：“那些围攻国会大厦的人是忠于一个人的……顺便说一句，这是对一个人的盲目忠诚。 ，至今仍是自由的。”

;

;特朗普的律师辩称，这些言论是在对一名冲击国会大厦的暴徒宣判时发表的，表明查特坎认为特朗普应该在预判中被起诉并入狱。

;

;第二个例子是，2021 年 12 月，法官对另一名 1 月 6 日的骚乱者说：“那些劝告你、鼓励你、团结你去采取行动和战斗的人，没有被指控，”并补充说，“我有我的意见”，但这超出了她的控制范围。

;

;特朗普的律师辩称，这些言论表明查特坎同意该暴徒的辩护律师的观点，后者表示特朗普错误地让他的支持者相信 2020 年选举存在欺诈行为，他们需要采取措施阻止权力的和平过渡。

;

;目前尚不确定法官的两份公开声明是否能满足免职的高标准。值得注意的是，该动议并未抱怨楚特坎迄今为止的任何预审裁决，也许是因为在少数情况下，她做出了不利于检察官的裁决。

;

;法律专家表示，如果法官拒绝回避的话然后，特朗普可能会寻求让美国华盛顿特区巡回上诉法院对该裁决进行审查，包括通过罕见的请求履行职责的举动，即向下级法院法官发出强制采取行动的司法命令。

;

;法律专家表示，上诉可能会伴随一项动议，要求在上诉期间中止 Chutkan 的裁决，这可能会推迟预审程序并推迟 ;当前审判日期;定为 2024 年 3 月，诉讼仍在继续。

;

;这样的推迟将是这对特朗普有利，他已明确表示，他对每起刑事案件的总体法律策略是寻求拖延 — — 最好是推迟到 2024 年总统大选之后，作为使自己免受指控的一部分。

;

;长期拖延的后果可能是深远的。如果此案要到 2024 年大选之后、特朗普连任后才判决，他可以尝试赦免自己，或指示司法部长让司法部完全撤销此案。

; Tue, 12 Sep 2023 07:52:01 +0800 Canadian man accused of killing Muslim family motivated by white nationalism, court hearshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/11/canada-man-nathaniel-veltman-murder-trial-muslim-family

;
;;2021 年 6 月 8 日，家人在一名驾驶皮卡车的男子被撞事故现场附近的临时纪念碑前表达敬意并杀害了加拿大安大略省伦敦一个穆斯林家庭的四名成员。
;

;该男子被指控;谋杀一个穆斯林家庭的四名成员;是出于白人民族主义信仰的动机，旨在实施“恐怖主义”行为，这可能会重塑加拿大的起诉方式极右极端主义。

;

;22 岁的纳撒尼尔·维尔特曼 (Nathaniel Veltman) 在驾驶卡车撞上阿夫扎尔 (Afzaal) 一家在伦敦散步时的五名成员后，面临四项谋杀指控和一项谋杀未遂指控。安大略省，2021 年 6 月 6 日晚。

;

;维尔特曼告诉警方，他杀死了阿夫扎尔一家的四名成员，但他对四项一级谋杀罪和一项未遂罪名表示不认罪。谋杀。他;还面临恐怖主义;指控。

;

;46 岁的萨尔曼·阿夫扎尔 (Salman Afzaal)、他的妻子马迪哈·萨尔曼 (Madiha Salman)、44 岁的女儿尤姆娜 (Yumna) 以及她 74 岁的祖母塔拉特·阿夫扎尔 (Talat Afzaal) 均在袭击中丧生。这对夫妇九岁的儿子也受了重伤，但幸存下来。

;

;检察官莎拉·谢赫(Sarah Shaikh)在安大略省温莎市的陪审团面前表示，维尔特曼在驾驶道奇车之前就计划了三个月的袭击计划。谢赫称，这名男子驾驶卡车“猛踩油门”，车辆冲过人行道的路缘石，扬起一团灰尘，撞到了受害者，“因为他们是穆斯林”。维尔特曼是附近斯特拉斯罗伊镇的一名蛋农，据称两周前购买了这辆车。

;

;检察官称，维尔特曼后来告诉侦探，他在袭击当天离开家寻找穆斯林杀害。 ，并补充说，他受到 2019 年基督城枪击事件的启发，该事件中一名白人民族主义者杀害了 51 人。他写了一份名为“白人觉醒”的宣言，并自称为白人民族主义者。警方搜查他家时，在他的电脑上发现了一份文件的两个版本。

;

;“我并不后悔我所做的事情。我承认这是恐怖主义。据称，他告诉侦探们，这是出于政治动机。

;

;谢赫说，在袭击过程中，维尔特曼穿着防弹衣和头盔，并在卡车里藏有锋利的武器。检方表示，这将表明维尔特曼离开了袭击现场，并要求附近商场的出租车司机报警。

;

;“是我。是我干的，”据称维尔特曼告诉司机。 “告诉他们是我干的，然后来逮捕我。”

;
;

;
; < p>;这起无耻的袭击在加拿大各地引起了震惊和悲痛，再次呼吁打击伊斯兰恐惧症。

;

;备受关注的案件;也可以澄清< /a>; 9 月 11 日美国袭击事件后通过的国家反恐法。 《恐怖主义法》中的规定要求警方证明维尔特曼出于政治、宗教或意识形态的动机，他打算恐吓或引起公众的恐惧。从历史上看，该法律曾被用来起诉在伊斯兰极端主义下实施暴力的人。维尔特曼的审判标志着该法律首次用于起诉据信受极右意识形态驱使的人。

;

;虽然袭击发生在伦敦市，但审判已转移前往温莎市。此举的原因受到出版禁令的约束。

;

;;2023-09-11T21:25:35Z;
;
;;詹姆斯·韦伯太空望远镜在太空中的艺术家插图。
;

;美国宇航局的科学家宣布数十光年之外的一颗巨大的系外行星上可能存在稀有的水海洋，并且也有潜在生命迹象的化学暗示。

;
;

;;相关：;;光的故事：美国宇航局重新构想的发现 - 在图片中;

;
;

;这一“有趣”的发现是由美国宇航局的詹姆斯·韦伯望远镜在早期研究的基础上，在距离地球 120 光年的狮子座中发现的利用韦伯的前身哈勃和开普勒对该区域进行了研究。

;

;研究人员将这颗系外行星命名为 K2-18 b，对于具有如此潜在意义的事物来说，这是一个不起眼的名字。美国宇航局表示，它的质量几乎是地球的九倍：“一颗海西系外行星，有可能拥有富含氢的大气层和被水海洋覆盖的表面”。

;

;太空该机构表示，对行星大气化学成分的观察表明存在海洋世界的可能性。报告称：“丰富的甲烷和二氧化碳以及氨的短缺支持了这样的假设：K2-18 b 富氢大气层下可能存在水海洋。”

;

;但是该机构还暗示了更显着的可能性，即可能发现一种名为二甲基硫醚 (DMS) 的分子，这种分子在地球上仅由生命产生。

;

;“地球大气中的大部分 DMS 是由浮游植物排放的NASA 新闻稿称。

;

;然而，DMS 的存在仍有待证实，并需要进一步调查。剑桥大学天文学家、美国宇航局研究的主要作者 Nikku Madhusudhan 表示：“即将进行的韦伯观测应该能够确认 K2-18 b 大气中是否确实存在显着水平的 DMS。”

;

;这并不是美国宇航局第一次在其他行星上发现水的迹象。之前在 ;较小的系外行星，HAT-P-11b;，大约与天鹅座中的海王星大小相同，距离也有 120 光年。

;

;但科学家们对这一发现感到兴奋，尽管他们警告说，这并不一定意味着地球可以支持生命。

;

;“我们的发现强调了在其他地方寻找生命时考虑不同的宜居环境的重要性，”Madhusudhan 说。

;

; >;“传统上，在系外行星上寻找生命主要集中在较小的岩石行星上，但较大的海西星世界显然更有利于大气观测。”

;

;这颗系外行星绕冷矮星 K2-18 运行，地球半径的 2.6 倍，位于美国宇航局所说的;宜居带;，恒星周围的一个区域，那里可能存在液态水行星。

;

;它的内部可能包含一个巨大的高压冰地幔，类似于海王星，美国宇航局说，但可能有更薄的氢-丰富的大气层和海洋表面。海星世界预计会有海洋，但在 K2-18 b 上，海洋也可能太热而无法居住。

;

;这颗行星的存在首先由 ;2015 年美国宇航局的 K2 任务;，但韦伯改进了技术早期的望远镜可以进行更详细的分析，并揭示它可能是一个海洋世界。科学家们能够研究穿过系外行星大气层的恒星光的一小部分。

;

;“这一结果之所以成为可能，是因为韦伯的波长范围得到了扩展，并且灵敏度前所未有，从而能够对恒星进行稳健的探测。 Madhusudhan 说，“仅用两次凌日观测就可以看到光谱特征。”

;

;“相比之下，韦伯望远镜的一次凌日观测所提供的精度与哈勃望远镜几年来在相对较窄的波长范围内进行的八次观测的精度相当。”< /p>;

;美国宇航局 (NASA) 于 7 月发布了一份;距离地球最近的恒星形成区域的“前所未有的”特写图像;。

;

;仅仅比今年，它让人类比以往任何时候都更接近宇宙的起源，并生成了遥远世界及其周围神秘结构的高分辨率图片。

;

;其中包括“罕见的” ;恒星处于死亡边缘的“转瞬即逝”阶段;；早期星系刚刚形成 ;大爆炸后 3.5 亿年;；以及“;宇宙破坏星系< /a>;”远比科学家想象的要大，有可能颠覆当前的宇宙学理论。

; Tue, 12 Sep 2023 05:52:02 +0800 MPs furious over being kept in dark about alleged spying for Chinahttps://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2023/sep/11/mps-furious-over-being-kept-in-dark-about-alleged-spying-for-china
;;2023-09-11T19:32:25Z;
;
;;林赛·霍伊尔周一在下议院发表讲话
;

;议员们发泄了六个月以来的愤怒一名在议会核心工作的助手因涉嫌为中国从事间谍活动并被指控违反《官方保密法》向北京传递信息而被捕，随后陷入沉默。

;

;他们周一对这一差距表示担忧。这意味着他们无法采取自己的安全预防措施，因为人们更广泛地担心个别民主活动人士可能因任何安全漏洞而面临风险。

;

;苏格兰民族党前座议员柯斯蒂·布莱克曼 (Kirsty Blackman) 询问为什么议会只知道对于周末媒体报道的指控，并呼吁尽快“对决策过程进行审查”。

;

;保守党议员蒂姆·劳顿(Tim Loughton)，此前曾因批评中国而受到制裁该国政权表示，议会安全部门或外交部或内政部尚未向议员们提供任何指导。

;

;下议院议长林赛·霍伊尔 (Lindsay Hoyle) 直接回应布莱克曼，表示“议员们需要霍伊尔补充说，调查人员需要时间来完成调查，并将这一事件描述为“一个重大安全问题”。

;

;这名 20 多岁的研究人员与另一名 30 多岁的人同时在爱丁堡被捕。据了解，他与保守党议员汤姆·图根哈特（Tom Tugendhat）有联系，直到他成为安全部长，随后又与外交事务特别委员会主席艾丽西亚·卡恩斯（Alicia Kearns）有联系。

;

;似乎只有少数议员受到了警告，跨党派外交事务特别委员会的其他成员表示，他们当时没有被告知逮捕的消息。

;

;警方消息人士还向《卫报》证实，目前还没有关于逮捕的公开报道。然而，一些高级部长已经意识到了这种情况。总理里希·苏纳克 (Rishi Sunak) 告诉议会，外交大臣詹姆斯·克莱维利 (James Cleverly) 在 8 月底访问中国时曾私下向他的同行提出过此事。

;

;“我的能力有限。我可以具体地说，但在与中国的接触中我已经明确表示，我们不会接受对我们的民主和议会制度的任何干涉。”苏纳克说。

;

;他补充道：“我绝对可以确认据议会高级消息人士称，英国议会安全团队“从一开始就积极参与”调查。他们表示，当局与安全部门合作，确定了被捕的议会研究员的身份。

; ;

;出于法律原因，《卫报》周一没有透露该研究人员的姓名在没有透露自己身份的情况下，他发表了一份声明，否认自己是间谍。

;

;“重要的是，让人们知道我是完全无辜的，”他在律师发表的言论中说道。

; >;

;“迄今为止，我的职业生涯一直在努力教育其他人了解中国共产党带来的挑战和威胁。做那些在夸张的新闻报道中对我提出的指控，将违背我所代表的一切。”

;

;这两名男子仍获得警方保释，直至 10 月初的某个具体日期，同时调查人员仍在调查此案。 ，这引发了人们对北京是否愿意监视英国的更多担忧。

;

;被捕的议会研究员与中国没有家庭关系。安全消息人士周一表示，他们认为所谓的间谍活动可能代表北京的间谍活动可能升级。

;

;“如果这被证明发生过一次，那么它不太可能是一个孤立的事件，一位前高级情报官员表示。

;

; Tue, 12 Sep 2023 04:52:01 +0800 Morocco quake survivors call for more help after entire villages destroyedhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/11/no-one-has-come-to-help-us-grief-and-frustration-in-quake-hit-moroccan-villages

;
;;一名妇女试图从 Tafeghaghte 村的家中取回她的一些财产。
;

;随着通往周五摩洛哥地震中一些受灾最严重地区的土路逐渐被清理，灾难的全部范围正在显现，包括豪兹省的整个村庄被毁。

;

;塔鲁伊斯特小村庄位于阿米兹米兹镇上方的阿特拉斯山麓，十几栋房屋中没有一栋幸存。只有村里的清真寺没有被夷为废墟。

;

;在一场造成至少 2,500 人死亡的灾难之后，第一批国际搜救队终于于周一部署到受灾最严重的地区，显然，寻找废墟下生还者的窗口正在迅速关闭。

;

;随着救援工作的加紧，《卫报》走访了一系列几乎完全被摧毁的山村，那里的居民表示，他们感到他们被遗弃了。

;

;在塔鲁伊斯特，人们描述了他们如何被迫将六名邻居的尸体抬下山，在那里他们遇到了私家车，因为还没有救护车或其他政府援助。

;

;“没有人来帮助我们，”哈桑·阿尔·马蒂 (Hassan al-Mati) 说道，他的母亲是死者之一，他的声音中充满了沮丧。 “我们需要卡车来帮助我们搬运埋在废墟中的动物尸体。我们需要帐篷和食物。我们感觉自己被抛弃了。

; ;

;“该村有六人死亡，六人受伤。我们必须把他们带到河边，然后用车把他们送到医院。”

;

;像这些山区的许多人一样，塔鲁伊斯特的村民现在睡在露天。哈桑带着《卫报》去见他的家人，他们坐在地毯上，用木杆上的床单遮挡阳光。

;

;其中两个孩子的脸上发现了被掉落的碎片击中的伤口。 。其中两名妇女显然仍处于震惊之中，其中一名妇女泪流满面。

;

;当被问及山上其他更高的村庄时，塔鲁伊斯特的居民列出了他们收到消息的村庄，所有这些村庄都受到了类似的破坏。< /p>;

;

;Ten minutes drive away, the scene in Tafeghaghte was more shocking still. Residents said 90 people had died here, in a village of about 400 that has existed for centuries.

;

;While the bodies of the dead had been dug out, remains of animals still lay in the rubble, causing a smell that permeated the place.

;

;Almost every person to whom the Guardian spoke told a story of horrific loss, some involving entire families.

; ;

;Abdelkebr ait al Ghouinbaz was standing on the ruined wall of his house surveying where his family had died. Two relatives were clambering through the rubble to recover what was left of his possessions.

;

;As they gathered up bedding, one of the men removed an envelope with a picture of a young woman in a white headscarf. The woman had died in the collapsed bedroom.

;

;“My wife, my father and my daughter were all killed,” Abdelkebr said. “I am alive because when I heard the noise [of the earthquake] I moved faster.”

; ;

;Other villagers told the same story.泰伊卜·艾特·拉古巴斯 (Taib ait Laghoubas) 说：“房子已经所剩无几了。”他的父母在一座房子里去世，现在只剩下门和门框了。 “一切都消失了。事情发生时我正在我的房子里。只花了几秒钟的时间。人们连逃跑的机会都没有。 My neighbours helped get me out.”

;

;He added: “We have food.那不是问题。 The biggest problem is that it is cold at night and we have no tents, no beds or clothes.”

;

;Taib said the Moroccan army had come to help in the immediate aftermath, bringing search dogs and helping dig people out of the rubble, but what they needed now was not coming.

;

;Asked whether there was anything to stay for, Taib said he would remain despite the devastation. “人们会留下来，因为他们出生在这里。 Amin, amin,” he added softly, appealing to God for peace.

;

;It was a picture that was not limited to one corner of these mountains but had become familiar across a vast swathe of the Atlas. Footage from the remote village of Imi N'Tala filmed by a Spanish rescuer, Antonio Nogales, of the aid group United Firefighters Without Border, showed men and dogs clambering over steep slopes covered in rubble.

; ;

;“The level of destruction is … absolute,” Nogales said, struggling to find the right word to describe what he was seeing. “没有一座房子是直立的。 We're going to start our search with dogs and see whether we can find anyone alive.”

;

;While aid efforts struggled to reach even these villages relatively close to the main road, rescuers were converging on the city of Amizmiz.

;

;Tented encampments for those who had lost their homes were appearing on every available patch of open ground and aid distributions were visible in neighbourhoods.

;

;Rescue workers cautioned that the chances of finding more survivors under the rubble were very slim, not least because of the nature of the disaster, with the most heavily damaged buildings made of clay brick that disintegrated almost entirely as they collapsed.

;

;“It's difficult to pull people out alive because most of the walls and ceilings turned to earthen rubble when they fell, burying whoever was inside without leaving air space,” a military worker told Reuters, asking not to be named because of army rules.

;

;In a field just outside Amizmiz, Moroccan troops and recently arrived international rescue teams, including a British government-deployed team that had arrived the night before, were setting up an extensive encampment.

;

;“We arrived late last night,” said Russ Gordon, the British team leader, as his personnel were already deploying to three locations. “目前我们仍在评估。我们还处于 72-96 小时的时间窗口内，如果被埋葬的人能够获得液体，他们可能会以某种方式生存。 Until it's called, we will operate as search and rescue operation before moving to a recovery effort.”

; Tue, 12 Sep 2023 04:52:01 +0800 Chile president gives staunch defence of democracy, 50 years after Pinochet couphttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/11/chile-president-coup-allende-pinochet-1973

;
;;An image of Salvador Allende, who was deposed in the 1973 coup. More than 40,000 were killed imprisoned, tortured or forcibly disappeared during the 17-year dictatorship.
;

;Chile's president has given an outspoken defence of democracy as the country marked the 50th anniversary of ;General Augusto Pinochet's coup d'état;, which ushered in 17 years of brutal military dictatorship.

;

;“Problems with democracy can always be solved … and a coup d'état is never justifiable – nor is endangering the human rights of those who think differently,” said Gabriel Boric in a speech outside La Moneda, the presidential palace bombed by British-built Hawker Hunter jets during the 1973 coup.

;

;Salvador Allende, the democratically elected leftwing president overthrown by the military, gave a final radio address to the nation before killing himself in his office at the palace as the tanks closed in. Before the restoration of democracy in 1990, more than 40,000 people became victims of torture, political imprisonment, execution or “forced disappearance”.

;

;“It is time to make up for these absences, correct the faults, repair the damage [and] project ourselves beyond our pain,” Boric said on Monday.

;

;The anniversary came against a gloomy backdrop for democracy in Latin America, where poverty and crime have helped populist figures on the left and right gain growing political support.

;

;According to the Latinobarómetro 2023 survey, favourable opinions of democracy are at a low ebb. Among respondents to the poll, one-third disagreed that democracy was the best system for government despite its problems.

;

;Boric was flanked by the presidents of Mexico, Bolivia, Colombia and Uruguay, as well as Portugal's prime minister. Out in front of La Moneda, the giant flag which flies on the concourse was lowered to half-mast.

;

;The atmosphere in Chile has been tense in the run-up to the commemoration.

;

;The Unión Demócrata Independiente, the rightwing party formed to uphold the legacy of the dictatorship – and one of several to refuse to sign a commitment to uphold democracy – issued a statement saying that the coup d'état was “inevitable”.

;

;It even went as far as to blame the “Chilean left” for the military takeover. As is customary for the party, and some on the Chilean right, the statement avoided the use of the term “dictatorship” or reference to a coup d'état.

;

;Earlier on Monday morning, Sergio Bobadilla, a congressman from the party, justified the coup, saying “there was no other way out”.

;

;Chile has no law that penalises denial, justification, minimisation or celebration of the serious human rights abuses perpetrated under the dictatorship.

; ;

;“Of course there was an alternative!”博里奇在致辞中说道。 “And tomorrow, when we live through another crisis, there will always be an alternative which implies more democracy, not less.”

;

;All four living ex-presidents – Michelle Bachelet and Ricardo Lagos, who attended the ceremony, and Eduardo Frei and Sebastián Piñera, who did not – signed Boric's four-point declaration, which sought to uphold democracy and guarantee that the events of 50 years ago would not be repeated.

;

;On Sunday night, hundreds of women participated in a candlelit procession around La Moneda chanting “;¡Nunca ;;más!;” – never again.

;

;Earlier in the day, amid tension on the eve of an anniversary that is often marked by protests, Boric had participated in a march down the Alameda, one of the main avenues through the centre of Santiago, alongside the relatives of forcibly disappeared people.

;
;

;;Related: ;;The Guardian view on the other 9/11: Pinochet's dictatorship casts a lengthening shadow | Editorial;

;
;

;Hooded protesters attacked parts of the march and smashed glass around the presidential palace. Others torched and attacked graves belonging to those linked to the dictatorship in the Cementerio General.

;

;Boric said that he “did not regret for a second” being “on the side of those who suffered” during the march.

;

;In August, Boric ;launched a plan to search for the disappeared;: the first time the Chilean state has resumed responsibility for the search.

;

;At present, 1,469 victims of forced disappearance are still missing. Just 307 have been found since Chile returned to democracy in 1990.

; Tue, 12 Sep 2023 04:22:02 +0800 Demolition of Marilyn Monroe’s house halted after widespread outragehttps://www.theguardian.com/film/2023/sep/11/marilyn-monroe-home-demolition-los-angeles
;;2023-09-11T19:05:46Z;
;
;;Marilyn Monroe poses outside her home during a photo call in 1956.
;

;The final home of Marilyn Monroe – and the only residence she ever owned independently – will remain standing for now after Los Angeles officials intervened to block the property's demolition.

;
;

;;Related: ;;Gentlemen Prefer Blondes at 70: Marilyn Monroe remains a dazzling star;

;
;

;The news that the new owners of 12305 Fifth Helena Drive, where Monroe died at age 36, filed for demolition permits had attracted widespread outrage. Los Angeles city councilwoman Traci Park said she received hundreds of calls urging her to save the Spanish colonial-style house in the city's Brentwood neighborhood.

;

;“Unfortunately, the department of building and safety issued a demolition permit before my team and I could fully intervene and get this issue resolved,” Park said at a ;news conference; last week, adding that there was a need for “urgent action”.

;

;Park introduced a motion to initiate consideration of the home for historic preservation, and the council unanimously voted to move forward, prompting the city's building department to revoke the demolition permit. The motion also prevents any major alterations to the property while the city reviews its potential status as a landmark.

;

;“This will be the first step in ensuring that we can protect this home against demolition,” Park said.

;

;The property, which features a guest house and swimming pool, was purchased in 2017 for $7.25m by Glory of the Snow LLC, then managed by a hedge fund executive, the ;Los Angeles Times; reported. It was sold to the Glory of the Snow Trust for $8.35m earlier this year.

; ;

;It's unclear what the mysterious new owner intends to do with the property. The owner did not submit any plans indicating what their plans are for the land, Park said at last week's press conference.

;

;Monroe purchased the single-story, 2,900-sq-ft (270-sq-meter) house in the early 1960s for $75,000 after the end of her third marriage to playwright Arthur Miller, according to the Times. It was the only residence the actress, who spent part of her childhood in an orphanage and foster care, ever independently owned.

;

;The screen legend, star of such films as Gentlemen Prefer Blondes, Some Like It Hot and The Misfits, was found dead in a bedroom of the home in August 1962. The cause of death was ruled to be acute barbiturate poisoning.

;

;Monroe had named the home Cursum Perficio, a Latin phrase meaning “My journey ends here”, which adorned tiles on the home's front porch.

;

;The global concern about the home reaffirms its significance, Park said.

;

;“For people all over the world, Marilyn Monroe was more than just a movie icon. Her story, from her challenging childhood growing up in orphanages and foster homes to becoming a global sensation, is a shining example of what it means to overcome adversity,” she said.

;

;“The overwhelming sentiment here is clear. This home must be preserved as a crucial piece of Hollywood's and the city of Los Angeles' history, culture and legacy.”

;

; Tue, 12 Sep 2023 03:22:01 +0800 Kremlin confirms Putin meeting as Kim reportedly boards armoured trainhttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/sep/11/kim-jong-un-reportedly-heading-to-russia-to-meet-putin

;

;The North Korean leader, Kim Jong-un, will visit Russia in the coming days at the invitation of ;Vladimir Putin;, the Kremlin has confirmed, amid concerns in the west that Pyongyang plans to provide weapons to Moscow to use in the war against Ukraine.

;

;An armoured train carrying Kim was reported by South Korean media to have departed Pyongyang for Russia via North Korea's north-eastern border, with a meeting expected to be held in the Russian port city of Vladivostok, where Putin has already arrived, as early as Tuesday.

;

;Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov said Putin would host a state lunch for Kim and the two would meet “one on one if necessary.” He said the two would discuss bilateral relations, adding: “We seek to build good, mutually beneficial relations with North Korea.”

;

;North Korean state news agency KCNA said the two leaders would “meet and have a talk”, without elaborating.

;

;;The trip; marks Kim's first visit abroad in more than four years and the first since the Covid-19 pandemic.

;

;“We do expect some type of meeting (and) based on the information we've been provided, KJU is travelling to Russia,” Pentagon spokesman Brigadier General Pat Ryder told reporters.

;

;The White House said last week it had intelligence that showed Russia was looking to purchase additional artillery shells from North Korea to shore up its defence industrial base.​​

;

;US officials also said the two countries were arranging a meeting between their leaders that would take place this month. The US national security adviser, Jake Sullivan, ;told reporters that North Korea “will pay a price”; for supplying Russia with weapons to use in Ukraine.

;

;North Korea has previously been accused by the US of selling artillery shells to the Russian mercenary group Wagner.

;

;The US, Britain, South Korea and Japan have said any arms deal between North Korea and Russia would violate UN security council resolutions.

; ;

;The meeting between the two leaders could take place at the Eastern Economic Forum, an annual conference scheduled to run until 13 September on the campus of the Far Eastern Federal University in Vladivostok.

;

;The Kremlin said on Monday that Putin had arrived in Vladivostok for a two-day visit to the forum.

;

;Kim and Putin, ;who first met in 2019;, are seeking greater military and economic cooperation to counter their growing international isolation prompted by Russia's invasion of Ukraine and North Korea's ballistic missile and nuclear weapons programmes.

;

;In July, Russia's defence minister, Sergei Shoigu, travelled to Pyongyang, where he toured a defence exhibition that featured the country's banned ballistic missiles.

;

;Analysts believe North Korea has an extensive supply of artillery shells, rockets and small arms ammunition that could help Russia replenish the military stocks it has expended in more than 18 months of war in Ukraine. In return, Moscow could share its advanced technology for satellites and nuclear-powered submarines.
